question:
Statement: The government has decided to increase the tax on luxury items.
Assumption:
1. Luxury items are not essential for common people.
2. The government needs more revenue.

Statement: Children are influenced more by movies than by books.
Assumption:
1. Movies are more appealing to children.
2. Books are not useful for children.

Statement: ‘Smoking is injurious to health’ – a warning on all cigarette packs.
Assumption:
1. People read warnings on packs.
2. Such warnings will reduce smoking.

Statement: To improve the state of education, the government must allocate more funds.
 Assumption:
 1. Lack of funds is one of the main reasons for the poor education system.
 2. The education system needs urgent reform.

Statement: We must reduce our dependence on imported oil.
Assumption:
1. Imported oil is costly.
2. Alternatives to oil are available.

Statement: The manager asked the workers to work overtime to complete the project on time.
Assumption:
1. The project can't be completed in time otherwise.
2. The workers may agree to do overtime.

Statement: Use vitamin-rich shampoo for strong and shiny hair.
Assumption:
1. People want strong and shiny hair.
2. Vitamins help improve hair quality.

Statement: The high court has prohibited any religious gathering in the area.
Assumption:
1. Religious gatherings are likely to disturb peace.
2. People obey high court orders.

Statement: Every student must submit the assignment before the due date to pass the exam.
Assumption:
1. Assignments are evaluated for exams.
2. Late submissions will not be accepted.

Statement: A job advertisement stated: 'Preference will be given to candidates with communication skills.'
Assumption:
1. Communication skills are not easy to find.
2. Communication skills are important for the job.

Statement: 'Switch off the lights when not in use' – a notice in offices.
Assumption:
1. Electricity should be conserved.
2. People don't switch off lights on their own.

Statement: More and more people are enrolling in fitness programs.
Assumption:
1. People are becoming health conscious.
2. Fitness programs are effective.

Statement: The government increased the price of petrol.
Assumption:
1. It wants to reduce petrol consumption.
2. It is trying to control inflation.

Statement: ‘Use of helmets is compulsory’ – a traffic department rule.
Assumption:
1. Helmets prevent serious injuries.
2. People may not wear helmets without compulsion.

Statement: Our roads are becoming dangerous due to rash driving.
Assumption:
1. Roads should be made safer.
2. Laws should prevent rash driving.
